column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hakkari
#Text=Hakkari is a city in Eastern Anatolia , in the far southeastern corner of the country .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The city of Hakkari itself is nothing to write home about .
#Text=Lots of army quarters but everyday life seems pretty normal .
#Text=Getting there makes it worth the trip , as you are literally in the most remote city of the country , near the corner where Turkish , Iranian , and Iraqi borders meet .
#Text=People seem to be indifferent to tourists ( or perhaps just a little cautious ) but usually react in a friendly way if you want to take their pictures .
#Text=You will hear very little Turkish .
#Text=Almost everybody in the streets speaks Kurdish .
#Text=Before World War I , the surrounding mountainous area was densely populated by the Chaldeans , who still call the area home to a smaller degree .

#Text=The Chaldeans are Eastern Catholics who reverted to communion with the Roman Catholic Church after the schism of 1552 , when they broke from the Syriac Orthodox Church , which in its turn broke from mainstream Christianity in the schism of 431 that came about after the Council of Ephesus .

#Text=In 1692 , a smaller group of Chaldeans ( re-)broke their communion with Rome , declaring themselves to be the members of the Assyrian Church of the East , an independent Eastern Christian denomination with a patriarchate in the village of Qodchanis ( modern Konak ) , northeast of Hakkari .
#Text=( In 1918 , the patriarchate was moved to Iraqi Kurdistan , and the former church in Qodchanis now lays in ruins . )
#Text=Get in
#Text=Frequent buses from Van make Hakkari easily accessible .
#Text=Get around
#Text=As Hakkari is not a big place
#Text=most of the town is within walking distance .
#Text=( But do read the " Stay safe " passage . )
#Text=It does spread out , however , over various hills .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Hakkari has three hotels .
#Text=None of them has its own website .
#Text=Star Otel , Atlılar Caddesi 12 , ☏ +90438 211-02-14 .
#Text=Central , somewhat dark and very sparse but OK for backpackers .
#Text=Better speak Turkish or use sign language .
#Text=You might be offered an inside room without a window .
#Text=Ask for a pencere ( payn-JAY-ray ) , which means window .
#Text=Cheap at 20-25 TL .
#Text=Hotel Sibar ( the former Ümit Hotel ) , Altay Caddesi 15 , ☏ +90438 211-25-05 , fax : +90438 211-24-69 .
#Text=This 3-star hotel is pretty modern and pretty good value for money .
#Text=Make sure you get to see the room before you book .
#Text=It offers street view , mountain view , and the wall of the building next door .
#Text=Negotiate .
#Text=They expect you to haggle .
#Text=They might start with 80 TL/person .
#Text=Try to settle for 60 .
#Text=But if you have the right room , you will enjoy the clean room with TV and fridge and spacious bathrooms with shower cabin and a western-style WC .
#Text=Mind your step when you leave the elevator on the ground floor .
#Text=Steps could be slippery .
#Text=This 3-star hotel is more old fashioned but also has spacious rooms .
#Text=Try to get one at the front for a good view of the main drag .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Travelling there is pretty safe as long as you stick to the main roads and/or use public transport .
#Text=Going for a wild walk ( to take pictures ) on your own even to the top of one of the hills close to the city could let you end up next to a military zone .
#Text=That could be very unpleasant as you may be thought to be a PKK agent and treated as such .
#Text=You should always have your passport or ID with you .
#Text=To a frustrated and rightly fearful soldier in these regions ( not the most comfortable place to be deployed ) , it seems to be difficult to differentiate between a tourist and a terrorist .
#Text=Connect
#Text=( +90 ) 438 is the area code for Hakkari .
#Text=Go next
#Text=There are several buses to Van daily leaving from the city centre to all sorts of places .
#Text=The only bus southwest to Şırnak leaves pretty early in the morning ( 7AM ) , though .
#Text=Check with big bus companies like Vangölü ☏ +904382114324 or Best Van ☏ +904382116734 .
#Text=Due to the regional conflicts there might be ID controls on the buses .
#Text=In case of bombings roads might also be closed , so do not rely on too tight a schedule .
